intro: Lophopappus berberidifolius, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its leaves are lobed and resemble those of the barberry plant, giving it its specific epithet. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
